{"id":398973801,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 years, 11 months","timestamp":1600739224,"status":15,"status_display":"Runtime Error","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/398973801/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Add Two Numbers","memory":"N/A","code":"/**\n * Definition for singly-linked list.\n * struct ListNode {\n *     int val;\n *     ListNode *next;\n *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}\n *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {\n        ListNode* sentinel = new ListNode(-1);\n        ListNode* head = sentinel;\n        int p = 0, q = 0, summ = 0, carry = 0;\n        \n        while (l1 || l2) {\n            p = l1 ? l1->val : 0;\n            q = l2 ? l2->val : 0;\n            summ = (p + q + carry) % 10;\n            carry = (p + q + carry) / 10;\n            head->next = new ListNode(summ);\n            head = head->next;\n            l1 = l1->next;\n            l2 = l2->next;\n        }\n        if (carry) {\n            head->next = new ListNode(carry);\n        }\n        return sentinel->next;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"add-two-numbers","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
